comment: @PaigePfleger @NPR Hi! Thanks for writing about this issue. I just want to echo what @PreventionAC, @marganina, and @Basceaux have said. Little risk provides the misconception that theres still a risk. Dr. Fauci and the NIH have said theres no risk for HIV to be transmitted sexually when u/d
@PaigePfleger @NPR Hi Paige! According to the CDC, viral suppression is actually 100% effective at preventing transmission. There is NO risk! https://t.co/dLTZ3yeBLo
@PreventionAC @NPR Hey there! The language the CDC uses is actually "effectively no risk" so the language we used in the piece aims to reflect that.

@PaigePfleger @NPR Extremely poor wording re: little risk. CDC says effectively no risk and uses the word effectively because it is not possible to statistically rule out a non-zero risk. All evidence to date suggests that it is not possible. https://t.co/R3PiwHYBow
@PaigePfleger @NPR Thank you for covering this! This, not the virus, is my biggest fear.
